title: How long does it take to write a typical blog post? - Quora

response.answer_text: How long it takes to write a blog post depends on a lot of factors. The post’s length.How technical the post is. More technical posts may require more research and citing.How familiar you are with the topic. Similar to #2, if you are new to the topic, you may need extra time to research the topic.How fast you write or type.How much effort you put into SEO. This includes, but is not limited to:Keyword research,Writing SEO friendly headlines,Writing SEO friendly titles, andAdding pictures or infographics.How much of a perfectionist you are. This is where I run into the biggest problem. I spend more time than is probably necessary revising.Bottom line, if you are blogging for just yourself and family/friends, your posts may not take long. If you are blogging to build authority and make money, then your posts will take much longer. The one thing to remember is patience and persistence. Results will be slow in coming but stick with it and constantly learn. Do that, and the results will come.

Disclaimer: I am from Team SEOPressor Connect A typical blog post of around 2,000 words should take you approximately 6 hours 20 minutes. Here’s our writing process with its allotted time frame: (Directed & Undirected) Research - A minimum of 40 minutes - It’s always good to provide information backed by research and data for value and clarity.Create An Outline - 30 minutes - Organize your findings from your research made. Give them headlines.Write Your First Draft - 3 hours - Now, write freely. Literally, “write drunk, edit sober.” Start from the introduction.Polish It With Editing - 1 hour - Now you’ve got your draft, it’s time to edit. Add missing stats, shorten long sentences, add formatting and add links wherever appropriate.Prepare Your Imagery - 1 hour - Images have the power to attract people to read and click into your blog post. Invest around an hour to come out with nice and appealing images.Optimize For Search Engines - 5 minutes/30 minutes - It takes us around 5 minutes to optimize for the search engine because we’re using our SEO plugin. Without a plugin, it should take around 30 minutes.Get A Great Title - 5 minutes - Last but not least, the title. This is the most important part of your blog post. Your blog post title determines whether or not the title will be the first and only impression you give to your users. Considering using these 28 emotion-invoking words and a Blog Title Generator.If you’re struggling to write a blog post, try our writing process today.
